oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Bushmans opinion of snuff-taking. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-26. 8266 rev. and 8267 rev.). The |xam believe that a person who takes snuff has his brain eaten up by tobacco until it disappears. 1) This story is found in Book VIII-26.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A person who takes snuff: tobacco eats up his brains
